avalancheActivity.comment:
The wind was moderate at times in particular along the border with France and along the border with Switzerland.
As a consequence of wind from westerly directions, sometimes deep wind slabs formed.
They can be released easily by a single winter sport participant, this also applies on steep slopes, caution is to be exercised in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
(--), in particular along the border with France. Remotely triggered avalanches are possible in isolated cases.
Natural avalanches: Dry slab avalanches and dry loose snow avalanches are still possible, especially on very steep slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Backcountry touring calls for meticulous route selection. Even single backcountry tourers can release avalanches.

snowpackStructure.comment:
30 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last few days. The moderate wind has transported the new snow.
The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs are bonding only slowly with the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes. Numerous medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large dry slab avalanches have been released on wind-loaded slopes.
On Friday in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain small and medium-sized avalanches were released. Isolated whumpfing sounds and natural avalanches serve as an alarm sign.

tendency.comment: The danger of natural avalanches will decrease gradually.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of a sometimes moderate wind from westerly directions, sometimes deep wind slabs formed.
They can be released. The avalanche prone locations are to be found on steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. The number and size of avalanche prone locations will increase with altitude.
Natural avalanches: Dry avalanches are possible, but they will be mostly small, especially on extremely steep slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs are to be evaluated with care and prudence.

snowpackStructure.comment:
20 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen above approximately 2000 m.
The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs are bonding only slowly with the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.
The old snowpack is favourably layered.
At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.

tendency.comment: The danger of natural avalanches will decrease gradually.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of a mostly light wind from westerly directions, small wind slabs formed.
These can in isolated cases be released by people.
The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on very steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found at intermediate and high altitudes and on very steep slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
10 to 20 cm of snow has fallen above approximately 1900 m.
The old snowpack will be in most cases well bonded.
Snow depths vary greatly at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, depending on the infuence of the wind.
At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.
